revised_title: Variational Principles for Perfect and Dissipative Fluid Flows: A Review
tldr: This article reviews variational principles for perfect and dissipative fluid flows, discussing the limitations of existing methods and suggesting an alternative approach. The author identifies the most general form of Hamilton's principle for perfect fluid flows and extends the variational principle to include viscous, thermally conducting fluid flows. The article compares this new approach with other variational principles for viscous flows and discusses their relative merits.
